meanings.definition: A satirical or lampooning piece of writing or speech.
meanings.sent1: The pasquinade in the newspaper made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a clever pasquinade about the silly politician.
meanings.sent3: The pasquinade at the comedy show was a hit with the audience.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a pasquinade, poking fun at the serious topic.
meanings.sent5: The pasquinade was so witty that it became a viral sensation.

meanings.definition: To mock or ridicule someone or something through satire or parody.
meanings.sent1: They pasquinaded the new movie for its poor acting.
meanings.sent2: He loves to pasquinade his friends in a playful manner.
meanings.sent3: The students pasquinaded the strict teacher in their school play.
meanings.sent4: She pasquinaded the fashion industry in her stand-up routine.
meanings.sent5: The comedian pasquinades celebrities in his hilarious sketches.
